conclusion: Analyze the car's motion through the ETC lane considering deceleration, acceleration, and initial and final speeds.
Identify initial and final conditions: Initial speed v0 = 30 m/s, Final speed v1 = 5 m/s, Distance to toll booth centerline d = 10 m.
Calculate time taken to decelerate from v0 to v1: t = v1/v0 = 1/6 s.
Calculate distance traveled during deceleration: d1 = v0 * t = 5 m.
Calculate time taken to accelerate back to v0: t = v0/v1 = 6 s.
Calculate distance traveled during acceleration: d2 = v1 * t = 30 m.
Calculate total displacement: Total displacement = d1 + d2 = 35 m.
Since total distance traveled is the same as distance to toll booth centerline, total displacement is 10 + 35 = 45 m.
The magnitude of the displacement of the car during the process is 45 m.
